Su-57 departure from Akhtubinsk Airbase, Astrakhan Oblast. Threat of Kh-59/69 cruise missiles.
2 Iskanders from Millerovo Airbase, Rostov Oblast to Dnipropetrovsk Oblast
These two Iskanders disappeared. Likely misidenitifcations
Su-57 departure from Akhtubinsk Airbase, Astrakhan Oblast. Threat of Kh-59/69 cruise missiles.
Two Su-57s are airborne and expected to launch Kh-69s.
Two Su-57s are airborne and expected to launch Kh-69s.
They are flying over Rostov District towards the Sea of Azov. They may launch towards the southern regions.
Approximate movements of missiles so far.
Approximate movements of missiles so far.
Gas and energy infrastructure have been hit the hardest. The Pavlohrad Chemical Plant was also targeted.
Power outages in Dnipro, Kyiv, Zaporizhzhia, Kharkiv, and Kherson
Scenes from Dnipro. The Thermal Power Plant has been hit by 6 Iskanders and at least 15 Geran-2 drones.
In addition to missiles, MLRS targeted energy infrastructure near Zaporizhzhia City, and in Kherson City.
There are still many Geran-2 drones in Ukrainian airspace. A minimum of 70 are detected.
Unidentified missile on Kharkiv
Unidentified missile on Kharkiv
Disappeared. No explosions were heard
Sumy is now under attack from Geran-2 drones
Talalaivka, Chernihiv Oblast is under attack from Geran-2 drones. 4 Iskander-M ballistic missiles impacted here earlier
The Iskander-M threat has been lifted from all areas except Millerovo Airbase, Rostov Oblast.
Unidentified missile on Lubny, Poltava Oblast. Flying over Chernihiv Oblast
Unidentified missile on Lubny, Poltava Oblast. Flying over Chernihiv Oblast
Something was briefly detected and disappeared. Not a missile.
Su-34 and Su-35 aircraft are flying near their launch lines in eastern Kursk Oblast. They may launch Kh-59/69 cruise missiles.
Su-34 and Su-35 aircraft are flying near their launch lines in eastern Kursk Oblast. They may launch Kh-59/69 cruise missiles.
They are carrying out launches of KAB glide-bombs towards Khotin, Sumy Oblast.

I have some things I need to do now, so I won't be able to cover any more missiles. Its likely that there will be some more cruise missiles launched (Iskander-K and/or Kh-59/69), but the bulk of the attack is now over.
I'll update you all in a few hours, and as usual, will provide a full, detailed summary on the attacks + reports on the consequences later on.
t.me/VodkaEcho
 will probably be posting about any more strikes tonight, so go check them out.

With Defeat Nearing In Pokrovsk, Ukrainian Troops Are Surrendering Or Attempting To Flee (Videos)
On November 7, the Russian military expanded its control in Pokrovsk in Donetsk as Ukrainian troops began making desperate attempts to flee from the key city and nearby Myrnohrad in small groups.
In its daily briefing, the Russian Ministry of Defense said that the 2nd Army, a part of the Tsentr [Center] Group of Forces, made gains in the eastern part of the Tsentralny neighborhood and on the territory of the industrial area to the west. It added that Ukrainian troops were cleared from Gnatovka and Rog, with 45 buildings captured in the last 24 hours.

Europe Seeks Military Schengen In Preparation For War Against Russia
By creating a military mobility agreement similar to Schengen to facilitate the faster transfer of troops and equipment across Europe, Western countries are preparing for war against Russia.¬†Nonetheless, in an age of modern technologies and new methods of warfare, the Russian military, which has real combat experience, is capable of waging 21st-century wars, which is why Western strategies in modern conflict are doomed to failure.
The European Commission, in cooperation with European Union member states and NATO, is developing a comprehensive plan that envisages the use of civilian transport ‚Äî from freight trains to ferries ‚Äî for the rapid transfer of military equipment and units in the event of a direct armed conflict with Russia, reported the Financial Times, citing sources familiar with the preparations.

Iran Came Close To Killing Israeli Ambassador In Mexico, Used Venezuela As Base 
The United States and Israel foiled an Iranian plot to kill the latter's ambassador to Mexico, Einat Kranz-Neiger, Axios reported on November 7.
Officials from the two countries told the news website that Mexican security services foiled the plot earlier this year. They claim that the Quds Force, the foreign operation branch of the Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps (IRGC), began planning the assassination last year.
According to Axios, the plot was led by an operative from the Quds Force‚Äôs Unit 11000, who spent years at Iran‚Äôs embassy in Venezuela recruiting Iranian agents from across Latin America.

Energy Under Attack: Russia's Systematic Strikes and Their Impact on Ukraine
On the night of November 7, Russia and Ukraine continued mutual strikes. According to data from the Russian Federation Ministry of Defence, air defence systems destroyed 11 UAVs over several regions. For its part, the Ukrainian Air Force reported an attack by Russia using 128 strike UAVs, of which, it claimed, 94 were destroyed or suppressed.
The Ukrainian side published maps of Russian strikes on energy facilities, gas infrastructure, and generating capacity over the past three months. Among the key targets are nodal substations in major cities of frontline regions such as Chernihiv, Sumy, Nikopol, and Kherson. Furthermore, active strikes are being carried out against hydroelectric and thermal power plants, including in western Ukraine. The loss of key coal deposits near Pokrovsk and Rodynske, as well as strikes on mines in Dobropillia and Pavlohrad, are also having a negative impact.

The Fall of Uspenivka: Ukraine Loses Key Stronghold On Yonchur River
The Russian ¬´East¬ª group completed operations in Uspenivka in the Zaporizhzhia sector. Units of the Russian ¬´Centre¬ª group have completed the encirclement of Myrnohrad.
